Settings used is a combination of following a template I had made... then creating my own script with more settings which clearly aren't in the log.

If your wondering.. all my encodes use a 3 pass process, not 2. And the first pass is slow.. so no shortcuts or anything to speed up encoding times. There are numerous programs out there that can allow you to feed similar settings in, but the Quality factors and such aren't all spelled out. It's not the same for every movie... I change the script slightly each time depending on the movie. Some of the trilogies usually use the same settings because further testing has proved to be identical. The LOTR series for example.

While as I stated in the end.. I don't technically use a program to do it, just have the libraries up to date (stable) and have the script ready.

People seem to flock to Handbrake or one of the "factory" programs.. megui and so forth.

Personally having tried numerous I've been relatively satisfied with how relatively simple and powerful Staxrip is. Highly recommend it. There is a lot of things to toy with, takes a bit of time to understand what it all does but a little patience and research will get you far.
